required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

brief_summary.textblock: This is a study to investigate the clinical effectiveness of the Sponsor's experimental cream treatment on eczema as measured by visual grading of SCORAD (scoring of atopic dermatitis).

detailed_description.textblock: This will be a 9-week, randomized, double blind, parallel comparison study consisting of a 1-week washout phase followed by an 8-week treatment phase. This study will be executed by one clinical research company utilizing two test sites and up to 62 subjects with moderate or severe atopic dermatitis, ages 12-65, will be enrolled. Subjects that are enrolled will be placed on one of three products (e.g. Sponsor's Experimental Cream Treatment, a basic moisturizer, or a positive control - Desonide) and will be required to use the assigned product twice a day for the duration of the 8-week treatment phase.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Subjects will be randomized and balanced into one of the 3 treatment groups by their baseline SCORAD grade (moderate = 25-40 and severe = 41+) and ethnicity (black or non-black).

primary_outcome.measure: Severity Scoring of Atopic Dermatitis (SCORAD) Amongst Subjects With Moderate Atopic Dermatitis
primary_outcome.description: SCORAD (Severity Scoring of Atopic Dermatitis) Change from Baseline to Week 8 of atopic dermatitis lesion as measured by the Scoring of Atopic Dermatitis (SCORAD). SCORAD is a composite severity index comprising a) the amount/extent of body area affected; b)b) 2 subjective symptom of pruritus (10 pts VAS) and sleep disturbance measured (10 pts VAS); and c) 6 disease intensity assessments [Dryness/Scaling, Erythema, Excoriation, Induration/Papulation, Lichenification and Oozing/ Weeping/Crusting, each graded in 3pts TIS from 0 (None) to 3 (Severe). A SCORAD score ranges from 0 (No AD present) to 103 SCORAD is calculated: Extent 7*Intensity SCORAD = --------- + ---------------- + Subjective 5 2

primary_outcome.measure: Severity Scoring of Atopic Dermatitis (SCORAD) Amongst Subjects With Severe Atopic Dermatitis
primary_outcome.description: SCORAD (Severity Scoring of Atopic Dermatitis) Change from Baseline to Week 8 of atopic dermatitis lesion as measured by the Scoring of Atopic Dermatitis (SCORAD). SCORAD is a composite severity index comprising a) the amount/extent of body area affected; b)b) 2 subjective symptom of pruritus (10 pts VAS) and sleep disturbance measured (10 pts VAS); and c) 6 disease intensity assessments [Dryness/Scaling, Erythema, Excoriation, Induration/Papulation, Lichenification and Oozing/ Weeping/Crusting, each graded in 3pts TIS from 0 (None) to 3 (Severe). A SCORAD score ranges from 0 (No AD present) to 103 SCORAD is calculated: Extent 7*Intensity SCORAD = --------- + ---------------- + Subjective 5 2

arm_group.description: Investigational Over the Counter (OTC) Cream will be applied topically, twice daily, for 8 weeks, once in the morning and once in the evening, to atopic dermatitis lesions and whole body as moisturizer.
Placebo Cream will be applied topically, twice daily, for 8 weeks, once in the morning and once in the evening, to atopic dermatitis lesions and whole body as body moisturizer.

Rx Steroid applied topically, twice daily, once in the morning and once in the evening, for 8 weeks to all atopic dermatitis lesions. Placebo Cream applied topically, twice daily, for 8 weeks, once in the morning and once in the evening, to whole body as body moisturizer, except atopic dermatitis lesions.

Placebo Cream applied topically, twice daily, for 8 weeks, once in the morning and once in the evening, to whole body as body moisturizer, except atopic dermatitis lesions.
Placebo Cream applied topically, twice daily, for 8 weeks, once in the morning and once in the evening, to atopic dermatitis lesions and whole body as body moisturizer.

category.title: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

measure.title: SCORAD
measure.description: SCORAD (Severity Scoring of Atopic Dermatitis) is a composite severity index comprising: Extent (a) of body area affected [graded 0-100]; Objective (b) assessments on the intensity of symptoms of Dryness/Scaling, Erythema, Excoriation, Induration/Papulation, Lichenification and Oozing/Weeping/Crusting, [each graded from 0 (None) to 3 (Severe)] Subjective (c) assessment of Itch and Sleep Disturbance, graded via 10 pt visual analog assessments SCORAD is calculated as a/5 + 3.5*b + c, with totals ranging from 0 (No Atopic Dermatitis) to 103 (Severe). A Lower SCORAD # is Better.

outcome.title: Severity Scoring of Atopic Dermatitis (SCORAD) Amongst Subjects With Moderate Atopic Dermatitis
outcome.description: SCORAD (Severity Scoring of Atopic Dermatitis) Change from Baseline to Week 8 of atopic dermatitis lesion as measured by the Scoring of Atopic Dermatitis (SCORAD). SCORAD is a composite severity index comprising a) the amount/extent of body area affected; b)b) 2 subjective symptom of pruritus (10 pts VAS) and sleep disturbance measured (10 pts VAS); and c) 6 disease intensity assessments [Dryness/Scaling, Erythema, Excoriation, Induration/Papulation, Lichenification and Oozing/ Weeping/Crusting, each graded in 3pts TIS from 0 (None) to 3 (Severe). A SCORAD score ranges from 0 (No AD present) to 103 SCORAD is calculated: Extent 7*Intensity SCORAD = --------- + ---------------- + Subjective 5 2
outcome.population: Subjects with moderate Atopic Dermatitis as defined by Baseline SCORAD 25-40

measure.title: Severity Scoring of Atopic Dermatitis (SCORAD) Amongst Subjects With Moderate Atopic Dermatitis
measure.description: SCORAD (Severity Scoring of Atopic Dermatitis) Change from Baseline to Week 8 of atopic dermatitis lesion as measured by the Scoring of Atopic Dermatitis (SCORAD). SCORAD is a composite severity index comprising a) the amount/extent of body area affected; b)b) 2 subjective symptom of pruritus (10 pts VAS) and sleep disturbance measured (10 pts VAS); and c) 6 disease intensity assessments [Dryness/Scaling, Erythema, Excoriation, Induration/Papulation, Lichenification and Oozing/ Weeping/Crusting, each graded in 3pts TIS from 0 (None) to 3 (Severe). A SCORAD score ranges from 0 (No AD present) to 103 SCORAD is calculated: Extent 7*Intensity SCORAD = --------- + ---------------- + Subjective 5 2
measure.population: Subjects with moderate Atopic Dermatitis as defined by Baseline SCORAD 25-40

analysis.groups_desc: Change from baseline in variables were analyzed separately using a mixed model for repeated measures with Subject nested within treatment (random effect), and Treatment, Week, Treatment-by-Week, Age & Baseline (fixed effects). Last Observation was Carried Forward (LOCF) for drops. Sporadic missing data were left missing.

outcome.title: Severity Scoring of Atopic Dermatitis (SCORAD) Amongst Subjects With Severe Atopic Dermatitis
outcome.description: SCORAD (Severity Scoring of Atopic Dermatitis) Change from Baseline to Week 8 of atopic dermatitis lesion as measured by the Scoring of Atopic Dermatitis (SCORAD). SCORAD is a composite severity index comprising a) the amount/extent of body area affected; b)b) 2 subjective symptom of pruritus (10 pts VAS) and sleep disturbance measured (10 pts VAS); and c) 6 disease intensity assessments [Dryness/Scaling, Erythema, Excoriation, Induration/Papulation, Lichenification and Oozing/ Weeping/Crusting, each graded in 3pts TIS from 0 (None) to 3 (Severe). A SCORAD score ranges from 0 (No AD present) to 103 SCORAD is calculated: Extent 7*Intensity SCORAD = --------- + ---------------- + Subjective 5 2
outcome.population: Subjects with severe Atopic Dermatitis (Baseline SCORAD = 41+)

measure.title: Severity Scoring of Atopic Dermatitis (SCORAD) Amongst Subjects With Severe Atopic Dermatitis
measure.description: SCORAD (Severity Scoring of Atopic Dermatitis) Change from Baseline to Week 8 of atopic dermatitis lesion as measured by the Scoring of Atopic Dermatitis (SCORAD). SCORAD is a composite severity index comprising a) the amount/extent of body area affected; b)b) 2 subjective symptom of pruritus (10 pts VAS) and sleep disturbance measured (10 pts VAS); and c) 6 disease intensity assessments [Dryness/Scaling, Erythema, Excoriation, Induration/Papulation, Lichenification and Oozing/ Weeping/Crusting, each graded in 3pts TIS from 0 (None) to 3 (Severe). A SCORAD score ranges from 0 (No AD present) to 103 SCORAD is calculated: Extent 7*Intensity SCORAD = --------- + ---------------- + Subjective 5 2
measure.population: Subjects with severe Atopic Dermatitis (Baseline SCORAD = 41+)

analysis.groups_desc: Change from baseline in variables were analyzed separately using a mixed model for repeated measures with Subject nested within treatment (random effect), and Treatment, Week, Treatment-by-Week, Age & Baseline (fixed effects). Last Observation was Carried Forward (LOCF) for drops. Sporadic missing data were left missing. Significance level: 0.05 (2-sided)
analysis.method_desc: Model adjusted means. Last Observation was Carried Forward (LOCF) for drops. Sporadic missing data were left miss

reported_events.time_frame: Adverse event data were collected during the subject's participation in the study (up to 8 weeks).

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The PI is employed by a contract research organization that is solely responsible for execution of the protocol. The contract research organization (and the PI) have signed a non-disclosure agreement, agreeing to keep all study-related information confidential. The Sponsor is responsible for data analysis.

point_of_contact.name_or_title: Laurie Moulton, M.S., Statistical Group Scientist
